{{unreferenced|date=August 2009}} {{Infobox road |province=BC |type=Hwy |route=29 |maint= |map= |length_km=237 |length_round= |length_ref= |alternate_name=Don Phillips Way |established=1967 |direction_a=South |terminus_a={{jct|state=BC|Hwy|52}} in [[Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia|Tumbler Ridge]] |junction={{jct|state=BC|Hwy|97}} near [[Chetwynd, British Columbia|Chetwynd]] |direction_b=North |terminus_b={{jct|state=BC|Hwy|97}} north of [[Fort St. John, British Columbia|Fort St. John]] |previous_type=Hwy |previous_route=28 |next_type=Hwy |next_route=30 }} '''Highway 29''', known locally as ''Don Philips Way'', is a shortcut route from the [[British Columbia Highway 97|John Hart Highway]] to the [[Alaska Highway]]. It is also the main access to the coal mining community of [[Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia|Tumbler Ridge]], as well as the [[W. A. C. Bennett Dam]] facility near [[Hudson's Hope, British Columbia|Hudson's Hope]]. The highway gained its '29' designation from [[Chetwynd, British Columbia|Chetwynd]] north to Hudson's Hope in [[1967]], and then [[1984|seventeen years later]], the road from Chetwynd south to Tumbler Ridge was given the same number.
==Route details==
In Tumbler Ridge, the 237 km (147 mi) long Highway 29 starts at a junction with [[British Columbia Highway 52|Highway 52]], and travels north northwest for 94 km (58 mi) to its junction with the [[John Hart Highway]] at Chetwynd. It follows the John Hart Highway through Chetwynd for 3 km (2 mi) east, then turns northwest for 65 km (40 mi) past [[Moberly Lake, British Columbia|Moberly Lake]] to Hudson's Hope, where a connector road to the W. A. C. Bennett Dam begins. 75 km (47 mi) northeast of Hudson's Hope, Highway 29 finally meets the Alaska Highway at a location known as Charlie Lake. {{BCHighways}}
